result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:28 PM Defendant Alan Lee Schade in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde in court for Alan Lee Schade.  Attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Court reviews recomm. (plead to Count 1, 5, 6) and will request PSI, restitution discussed; victim rights complied with; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Robbery of Financial Inst. in Count 1, Misd. Theft-Movable Property (<=$2,500) in Count 5 and Felony BJ in Count 6; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Count 1 Robbery of Financial Inst., guilty of Count 5 Misd. Theft-Movable Property (<=$2500) and guilty of Count 6 Felony BJ w/Counts 2,3,4,7&8 are D&RI; Court will order PSI; Court reviews no voting, no firearms; discussion on scheduling; State notes may be consolidated with Jefferson Co. case; SEH set; bond cont.

01:05 PM Defendant Alan Lee Schade in court, in custody with attorney Katherine Marie Findley (eligible).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $250,000 Cash bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim business and its employees.   Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin while the case is pending.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
